15/*! \file
16 * \brief
17 * Entry points into portable SPNEGO implementation.
18 * See spnego.c for information on the SPNEGO implementation itself.
19 */
20
21#ifndef _SPNEGO_H_
22#define _SPNEGO_H_
23
24/*%
25 * Wrapper for GSSAPI gss_init_sec_context(), using portable SPNEGO
26 * implementation instead of the one that's part of the GSSAPI
27 * library. Takes arguments identical to the standard GSSAPI
28 * function, uses standard gss_init_sec_context() to handle
29 * everything inside the SPNEGO wrapper.
30 */
31OM_uint32
32gss_init_sec_context_spnego(OM_uint32 *,
33 const gss_cred_id_t,
34 gss_ctx_id_t *,
35 const gss_name_t,
36 const gss_OID,
37 OM_uint32,
38 OM_uint32,
39 const gss_channel_bindings_t,
40 const gss_buffer_t,
41 gss_OID *,
42 gss_buffer_t,
43 OM_uint32 *,
44 OM_uint32 *);
45
46/*%
47 * Wrapper for GSSAPI gss_accept_sec_context(), using portable SPNEGO
48 * implementation instead of the one that's part of the GSSAPI
49 * library. Takes arguments identical to the standard GSSAPI
50 * function. Checks the OID of the input token to see if it's SPNEGO;
51 * if so, processes it, otherwise hands the call off to the standard
52 * gss_accept_sec_context() function.
53 */
54OM_uint32 gss_accept_sec_context_spnego(OM_uint32 *,
55 gss_ctx_id_t *,
56 const gss_cred_id_t,
57 const gss_buffer_t,
58 const gss_channel_bindings_t,
59 gss_name_t *,
60 gss_OID *,
61 gss_buffer_t,
62 OM_uint32 *,
63 OM_uint32 *,
64 gss_cred_id_t *);
65
66
67#endif
68
